content.raw: Apologies, missed this! I think keyboard inputs should still work if the Settings menu is open. Users may want to tweak the settings, and leaving the menu open would allow them to do this more quickly.  Poking around in a couple other applications, it seems that having a top menu open is in a sense modal. If a top menu is open, the user can't interact with the rest of the application. Let's go with that. Top menu = disable scene control, but Settings menu = enable scene control
